intro: Mesembryanthemum rubroluteum, commonly known as the red and yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant orange to yellow flowers that open in the late afternoon and close at dawn. Its leaves are typically fleshy and covered in a waxy coating, which helps it conserve water in arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to dry conditions.
